taskman.backend.resource

Class ResourceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskman.backend.resource.ResourceManager

  • public class ResourceManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for creating, storing and retrieving resources of the system.
    Author:
    Jeroen Van Der Donckt, Julien Benaouda

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ResourceManager()
      Construct an empty resource userManager.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ResourceManager

        public ResourceManager()
        Construct an empty resource userManager.
        Postcondition:
        the set of resource types is set to a new HashsSet and the list of constraints is set to a new Arraylist

      • createResourceType

        public void createResourceType(java.lang.String name)
        Creates and adds the resource type with the given name to the resource types.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the resource type
        Postcondition:
        a resource type with given name is created and added to the resource types

      • createConstraint

        public void createConstraint(java.lang.String string)
        Creates a constraint from a given string.
        Parameters:
        string - a string which represents a constraint
        Postcondition:
        adds a constraint to the resource userManager
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the string does not represent a valid constraint
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if a number in the string cannot be parsed to an integer

      • getStartingTimes

        public java.util.Iterator<java.time.LocalDateTime> getStartingTimes(Plan plan,
                                                                    long duration,
                                                                    java.time.LocalDateTime startTime)
                                                             throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Returns an iterator of the starting times (on or after the given time) for the given task.
        Parameters:
        plan - the plan to get the starting times for
        duration - the duration of the reservations
        startTime - the time on or before the starting times
        Returns:
        an iterator of starting times (on or after the given time) for the given task
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there is no next element in the iterator

        public void testRequirements(java.util.Map<ResourceType,java.lang.Integer> requirements)
        Tests a map of requirements on its correctness.
        Parameters:
        requirements - the requirements to test
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the requirements are not valid

      • createResourceForUser

        public void createResourceForUser(User user,
                                  java.time.LocalTime startBreak)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new resource from the given user.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to use for the resource creation
        Postcondition:
        a new user resource is created and the resource is added to the user
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the break is null.

      • removeResourceForUser

        public void removeResourceForUser(User user)
        Removes the resource of the given user.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to use for the resource removal
        Postcondition:
        the user resource is removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the resource cannot be removed.

                           TimeSpan newTimeSpan)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Reschedule a plan to a given time span.
        Parameters:
        plan - the plan.
        newTimeSpan - the new time span.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the plan cannot be rescheduled.

      • canBeRescheduled

        public boolean canBeRescheduled(Plan plan,
                                TimeSpan newTimeSpan)
        Returns if the planned task can be rescheduled.
        Parameters:
        plan - a plan.
        newTimeSpan - the time span to check.
        Returns:
        true if the plan can be rescheduled, otherwise false.
